home.title: Diaomao
home.webTitle: Diaomao AI-Orchestrated SaaS | Pricing, Credits, Docs & Stripe
home.webDescription: Ship an AI-era product site fast: Diaomao packs Next.js + Prisma + PostgreSQL + Stripe with orchestrated pricing, credit gates, docs, and navigation—ready for real payments and growth.
home.keywords: AI product template, Next.js SaaS, Stripe pricing, credit billing UI, Fumadocs, Prisma PostgreSQL, fingerprint onboarding, Money Price, Credit Overview

hero.description: An orchestrated template for the AI age: pricing that knows your users, credit engines that guide upgrades, docs and navigation that stay in sync, and Stripe flows that simply work.
hero.about: SSR-stable, mobile-respectful, with fingerprint-to-Clerk onboarding baked in

usage.title: Make it yours
usage.description: An AI + product-orchestrated base—configure, ship, and sell.

steps.title: Wire the stack
steps.description: Add Stripe secrets, PostgreSQL, and Clerk—InitUserContext + Prisma schema hydrate SSR pricing and credits on day one.

steps.title: Orchestrate the product
steps.description: Tune billing toggles, credit buckets, and CTA behaviors in config; Money Price and Credit Overview adapt to user state and device.

steps.title: Launch the story
steps.description: Fumadocs + Header Mega Menu keep navigation and docs in sync; gradients and accessibility are pre-tuned across devices.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Core flows are prebuilt—these answers clarify what ships out of the box.

items.question: What is Diaomao?
items.answer: An AI-era product template: Next.js + Prisma + PostgreSQL + Stripe, with Money Price, Credit Overview, fingerprint-to-Clerk onboarding, and Fumadocs navigation/docs.

items.question: Does it support both subscriptions and one-time credit packs?
items.answer: Yes. Money Price covers subscriptions and one-time credit packs; billing toggles are configurable, and upgrade buttons fall back to Portal/Checkout.

items.question: How are anonymous users handled?
items.answer: First visit issues a fingerprint ID, starter credits, and records; after login the same context persists, balances stay intact, and SSR avoids first-screen flicker.

items.question: Can I change the navigation and docs layout?
items.answer: Yes. Header supports mega menus, pinned mobile actions, and secondary buttons; Fumadocs is config-driven for cards, banners, and per-device ordering.

items.question: What Stripe lifecycle is covered?
items.answer: Checkout/Portal, async confirms, renewals, dunning, refunds, end-of-period cancel, and upgrade/downgrade all map to Transactions/Subscriptions with event.id + order_id idempotency.

tips.title: Tips for Getting the Best Results with

sections.title: Configure before coding
sections.description: Pricing, credits, navigation, and CTAs are config/translation-driven—tune parameters before touching code.

sections.title: Keep billing options
sections.description: Even if you default to onetime, leave monthly/yearly available to avoid dead ends.

sections.title: Honor device behaviors
sections.description: Mobile uses redirects/auth then closes; desktop can modal—follow the design guide for scroll and close timing.

sections.title: Prefer SSR context
sections.description: Use InitUserContext to prehydrate user state—no first-screen jitter, billing defaults match reality.

sections.title: Follow the schema
sections.description: Stick to Users/Subscriptions/Transactions/Credits; order_id + event.id keep webhooks idempotent.

sections.title: Tell the story in docs
sections.description: Use Fumadocs cards and banners to ship product narrative and releases without extra styling.

seoContent.title: The AI-era product chassis with
seoContent.description: Pricing, credits, docs, navigation, and Stripe orchestrated as one.
seoContent.intro: Diaomao compresses the slowest parts of shipping AI products into one template: Money Price runs subscription/onetime in parallel, Credit Overview governs buckets and CTA matrix, fingerprint-to-Clerk prevents funnel gaps, Stripe lifecycle and schema are pre-aligned, and Fumadocs + Header keep story and navigation consistent.

sections.title: Pricing that adapts to user state
sections.content: Billing pills switch monthly|yearly|onetime; SSR defaults to the user’s plan, and upgrade buttons honor enableSubscriptionUpgrade with Portal fallback.

sections.title: Credits with clear buckets and CTA matrix
sections.content: Buckets, expiry hints, and device-aware actions: desktop modals or auth-to-Portal, mobile redirects or custom handlers.

sections.title: Anonymous-first onboarding
sections.content: Fingerprint issues `fp_xxx`, grants starter credits, and writes records; after login the same context continues with balances and audit intact.

sections.title: Stripe lifecycle baked in
sections.content: Checkout|Portal, async confirmation, renewal, past-due, refund, end-of-period cancel, upgrade|downgrade—all guarded by order_id metadata and webhook idempotency.

sections.title: Navigation and docs that scale
sections.content: Header mega menu, pinned behaviors, and actionOrders keep Docs|pricing|auth buttons in place; Fumadocs cards and banners ship with no extra styling.

sections.title: Schema-first reliability
sections.content: Users, Subscriptions, Credits, Transactions, CreditAuditLog indexed for fingerprint lookup, order routing, and audit stability.

seoContent.conclusion: Plug in keys, tune config, fill copy—launch an AI-ready, revenue-ready, story-ready site in a week.
